subtopics: Locally Repairable Codes (LRC) via cyclic locality checks
objectives: Fuse locality and self-orthogonality constraints over GF(13), n = 12, to derive a definitive, verifiable conclusion.
Use defining-set and factor/zero-set interplay to prove a contradiction.
Provide an exact, single-integer answer (the count of admissible codes).
required_theorems: Duals of cyclic codes: defining-set relation Z(C^⊥) = Z_n \ (−Z(C))
Mattson–Solomon transform diagonalization for cyclic codes
Locality via ν-term parity-check factors in the dual
pitfalls: Equating zeros of g and h; mixing up roles of generator vs parity-check polynomials
Incorrect handling of negation in Z/12Z; must use Z ∪ (−Z) = Z_n for self-orthogonality (0 and 6 included)
Assuming L | h ⇒ L ∈ C^⊥; correct condition is h | L (since C^⊥ is generated by h^*)
constraints: Field GF(13), length n = 12, α = 2 as the fixed primitive 12th root
h(x) divisible by L(x) = 1 + x^4 + x^8
